title: About
text:
The Plant Agriculture Field Trip course, which is better known around campus as the Midwest Tour, is a field study course designed to increase the student’s breadth of knowledge of agricultural production and agri-business in North America. Students in the course tour a selected area of the US Midwest Region prior to the fall semester, visiting cash crop and livestock farms, supporting industries (e.g. processing, manufacturing) and markets (e.g. elevators, stockyards)
If you came across this site by chance, you may be interested in checking out our roots at the University of Guelph, the Ontario Agriculture College and the Department of Plant Agriculture.

Instructors
Professor Liz Lee  Department of Plant Agriculture  University of Guelph 
Assistant Professor Adrian Correndo  Department of Plant Agriculture  University of Guelph

title: Day 10: Tuesday, Sept 3rd
text:
DESTINATIONS

1. Wagonhammer Ranch

Route: Somewhere near Bartlett, NE
Address: Somewhere near Bartlett, NE, will need to get a pin drop from Jay.
Contact: Alex Wolf Alex@wagonhammer.com, Jay Wolf (semi-retired) Jay@wagonhammer.com 402-920-2853 (Jay’s cell) 402-741-2809 (Alex’s cell)
Note: We have been coming here since 1984, missed a few years with COVID and 2023. They have 2 contiguous blocks of land, one is about 10,000 acres and the other is about 25,000 acres. They have a feedlot down in Albion NE which we are not seeing. They are a seedstock producer of Angus, Charolais, and more recently Simmental and Sim-Angus.
Arrive: 8:00am
Depart: 10:30am
Gifts: 3-4

title: Midwest Tour 2024
text: This blog will document our exciting trip to the US Midwest. Click on the links below to read about each day’s activities and logistic details.
